subject: Psychology
title: Digital Habits and Screen Time
description: A 60-second lesson on Digital Habits and Screen Time.

hook.text: You pick up your phone to check the time and 30 minutes later you're deep in social media. The cue hijacked you.

buildup.text: Digital habits are among the strongest modern loops â€” endless content provides variable rewards that never satisfy.

discovery.text: Tech companies engineer for habit formation: notifications are cues, scrolling is the routine, novelty is the reward.

twist.text: Breaking digital habits uses the same science: remove cues, add friction, and find better rewards for the same needs.

climax.text: The phone isn't the problem. The habit loop around it is. Redesign the loop and you reclaim your attention.

punchline.text: Your phone is designed to be a habit. Design your life back.

quiz.question: Why are digital habits particularly strong?
options: Endless variable rewards from content that never fully satisfy
Screens have no effect on habitual behavior
Digital devices are designed to break habits
